member.summary: Constructs an XML encoder/decoder with a new owner document.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Constructs an XML encoder/decoder for the specified owner document. The document is required to resolve forward ID references. This means if you parse a graphmodel that is represented in XML you must also pass the document that contains the XML to the constructor, otherwise forward references will not be resolved.
member.param: Optional XML document that contains the data. If no document is specified then a new document is created using mxUtils.createDocument

member.name: P:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.Document
member.summary: Sets or returns the owner document of the codec.
member.returns: Returns the owner document.

member.name: P:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.IsEncodeDefaults
member.summary: Sets or returns if default values of member variables should be encoded.

member.name: P:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.Objects
member.summary: Returns the object lookup table.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.PutObject(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Assoiates the given object with the given ID.
member.param: ID for the object to be associated with.
Object to be associated with the ID.
member.returns: Returns the given object.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.GetObject(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the decoded object for the element with the specified ID in document. If the object is not known then lookup is used to find an object. If no object is found, then the element with the respective ID from the document is parsed using decode.
member.param: ID of the object to be returned.
member.returns: Returns the object for the given ID.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.Lookup(System.String)
member.summary: Hook for subclassers to implement a custom lookup mechanism for cell IDs. This implementation always returns null.
member.param: ID of the object to be returned.
member.returns: Returns the object for the given ID.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.GetElementById(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the element with the given ID from the document.
member.param: ID of the element to be returned.
member.returns: Returns the element for the given ID.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.GetId(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the ID of the specified object. This implementation calls reference first and if that returns null handles the object as an mxCell by returning their IDs using mxCell.getId. If no ID exists for the given cell, then an on-the-fly ID is generated using mxCellPath.create.
member.param: Object to return the ID for.
member.returns: Returns the ID for the given object.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.Reference(System.Object)
member.summary: Hook for subclassers to implement a custom method for retrieving IDs from objects. This implementation always returns null.
member.param: Object whose ID should be returned.
member.returns: Returns the ID for the given object.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Encodes the specified object and returns the resulting XML node.
member.returns: Returns an XML node that represents the given object.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.Decode(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Decodes the given XML node using decode(XmlNode, Object).
member.returns: Returns an object that represents the given node.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.Decode(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.summary: Decodes the given XML node. The optional "into" argument specifies an existing object to be used. If no object is given, then a new instance is created using the constructor from the codec. The function returns the passed in object or the new instance if no object was given.
member.param: Optional object to be decodec into.
member.returns: Returns an object that represents the given node.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.EncodeCell(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxICell,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encoding of cell hierarchies is built-into the core, but is a higher-level function that needs to be explicitely used by the respective object encoders (eg. mxModelCodec, mxChildChangeCodec and mxRootChangeCodec). This implementation writes the given cell and its children as a (flat) sequence into the given node. The children are not encoded if the optional includeChildren is false. The function is in charge of adding the result into the given node and has no return value.
member.param: Parent XML node to add the encoded cell into.
Boolean indicating if the method should include all descendents

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.DecodeCell(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decodes cells that have been encoded using inversion, ie. where the user object is the enclosing node in the XML, and restores the group and graph structure in the cells. Returns a new mxCell instance that represents the given node.
member.param: XML node that contains the cell data.
Boolean indicating whether the graph structure should be restored by calling insert and insertEdge on the parent and terminals, respectively.
member.returns: Graph cell that represents the given node.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.InsertIntoGraph(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxICell)
member.summary: Inserts the given cell into its parent and terminal cells.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec.SetAttribute(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the attribute on the specified node to value. This is a helper method that makes sure the attribute and value arguments are not null.
member.param: XML node to set the attribute for.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.#ctor(System.Object,System.String[],System.String[],System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Constructs a new codec for the specified template object. The variables in the optional exclude array are ignored by the codec. Variables in the optional idrefs array are turned into references in the XML. The optional mapping may be used to map from variable names to XML attributes.
member.param: Prototypical instance of the object to be encoded/decoded.
Optional array of fieldnames to be ignored.
Optional array of fieldnames to be converted to/from references.
Optional mapping from field- to attributenames.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.GetName
member.summary: Returns the name used for the nodenames and lookup of the codec when classes are encoded and nodes are decoded. For classes to work with this the codec registry automatically adds an alias for the classname if that is different than what this returns. The default implementation returns the classname of the template class.

member.summary: Parses the given node into the object or returns a new object representing the given node.
member.param: Codec that controls the encoding process.
member.returns: Returns the resulting object that represents the given XML node.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.Decode(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.summary: Parses the given node into the object or returns a new object representing the given node. Dec is a reference to the calling decoder. It is used to decode complex objects and resolve references. If a node has an id attribute then the object cache is checked for the object. If the object is not yet in the cache then it is constructed using the constructor of template and cached in mxCodec.objects. This implementation decodes all attributes and childs of a node according to the following rules: - If the variable name is in exclude or if the attribute name is "id" or "as" then it is ignored. - If the variable name is in idrefs then mxCodec.getObject is used to replace the reference with an object. - The variable name is mapped using a reverse mapping. - If the value has a child node, then the codec is used to create a child object with the variable name taken from the "as" attribute. - If the object is an array and the variable name is empty then the value or child object is appended to the array. - If an add child has no value or the object is not an array then the child text content is evaluated using mxUtils.eval. If no object exists for an ID in idrefs a warning is issued using mxLog.warn. Returns the resulting object that represents the given XML node or the configured given object.
member.param: Codec that controls the encoding process.
Optional objec to encode the node into.
member.returns: Returns the resulting object that represents the given XML node or the object given to the method as the into parameter.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.DecodeNode(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.summary: Calls decodeAttributes and decodeChildren for the given node.

member.summary: Decodes all attributes of the given node using decodeAttribute.

member.summary: Reads the given attribute into the specified object.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.DecodeChildren(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.summary: Reads the given attribute into the specified object.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.DecodeChild(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.summary: Reads the specified child into the given object.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.GetFieldTemplate(System.Object,System.String,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Returns the template instance for the given field. This returns the value of the field, null if the value is an array or an empty collection if the value is a collection. The value is then used to populate the field for a new instance. For strongly typed languages it may be required to override this to return the correct collection instance based on the encoded child.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.AddObjectValue(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the decoded child node as a value of the given object. If the object is a map, then the value is added with the given fieldname as a key. If the fieldname is not empty, then setFieldValue is called or else, if the object is a collection, the value is added to the collection. For strongly typed languages it may be required to override this with the correct code to add an entry to an object.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.ProcessInclude(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.param: Codec that controls the encoding/decoding process.
Optional object to pass-thru to the codec.
member.returns: Returns true if the given node was processed as an include.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.BeforeDecode(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.summary: Hook for subclassers to pre-process the node for the specified object and return the node to be used for further processing by decode. The object is created based on the template in the calling method and is never null. This implementation returns the input node. The return value of this function is used in decode to perform the default decoding into the given object.
member.param: Codec that controls the decoding process.
Object to encode the node into.
member.returns: Returns the node used for the default decoding.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxObjectCodec.AfterDecode(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.io.mxCodec,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.summary: Hook for subclassers to Receive-process the object after decoding. This implementation returns the given object without any changes. The return value of this method is returned to the decoder from decode.
member.param: Codec that controls the decoding process.
Object that represents the default decoding.
member.returns: Returns the result of the decoding process.

member.name: T:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry
member.summary: Represents the geometry of a cell. For vertices, the geometry consists of the x- and y-location, as well as the width and height. For edges, the edge either defines the source- and target-terminal, or the geometry defines the respective terminal points.

member.summary: Global switch to translate the points in translate. Default is true.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry.alternateBounds
member.summary: Stores alternate values for x, y, width and height in a rectangle. Default is null.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry.sourcePoint
member.summary: Defines the source-point of the edge. This is used if the corresponding edge does not have a source vertex. Otherwise it is ignored. Default is null.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry.targetPoint
member.summary: Defines the target-point of the edge. This is used if the corresponding edge does not have a source vertex. Otherwise it is ignored. Default is null.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry.offset
member.summary: Holds the offset of the label for edges. This is the absolute vector between the center of the edge and the top, left point of the label. Default is null.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry.points
member.summary: List of mxPoints which specifies the control points along the edge. These points are the intermediate points on the edge, for the endpoints use targetPoint and sourcePoint or set the terminals of the edge to a non-null value. Default is null.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry.relative
member.summary: Specifies if the coordinates in the geometry are to be interpreted as relative coordinates. Default is false. This is used to mark a geometry with an x- and y-coordinate that is used to describe an edge label position.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new geometry at (0, 0) with the width and height set to 0.

member.summary: Constructs a copy of the given geometry.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGeometry.Translate(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Translates the geometry by the specified amount. That is, x and y of the geometry, the sourcePoint, targetPoint and all elements of points are translated by the given amount. X and y are only translated if the geometry is not relative. If TRANSLATE_CONTROL_POINTS is false, then are not modified by this function.
member.param: Integer that specifies the x-coordinate of the translation.
Integer that specifies the y-coordinate of the translation.

member.summary: Returns a new instance of the same geometry.
member.returns: Returns a clone of the geometry.

member.name: T:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel
member.summary: Implements a graph model. The graph model acts as a wrapper around the cells which are in charge of storing the actual graph datastructure. The model acts as a transactional wrapper with event notification for all changes, whereas the cells contain the atomic operations for updating the actual datastructure.

member.name: E:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.GraphModelChange
member.summary: Fires when the graph model has changed.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.root
member.summary: Holds the root cell, which in turn contains the cells that represent the layers of the diagram as child cells. That is, the actual element of the diagram are supposed to live in the third generation of cells and below.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.cells
member.summary: Maps from Ids to cells.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.createIds
member.summary: Specifies if edges should automatically be moved into the nearest common ancestor of their terminals. Default is true.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.maintainEdgeParent
member.summary: Specifies if the parent of edges should be automatically change to point to the nearest common ancestor of its terminals. Default is true.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.nextId
member.summary: Specifies the next Id to be created. Initial value is 0.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.updateLevel
member.summary: Counter for the depth of nested transactions. Each call to beginUpdate increments this counter and each call to endUpdate decrements it. When the counter reaches 0, the transaction is closed and the respective events are fired. Initial value is 0.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new empty graph model.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructs a new graph model. If no root is specified then a new root mxCell with a default layer is created.
member.param: Cell that represents the root cell.

member.summary: Sets a new root using createRoot.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.CreateRoot
member.summary: Creates a new root cell with a default layer (child 0).

member.name: P:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.IsMaintainEdgeParent
member.summary: Sets of returns if edges should automatically be moved into the nearest common ancestor of their terminals.

member.name: P:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.IsCreateIds
member.summary: Sets or returns if the model automatically creates Ids and resolves Id collisions.

member.summary: Inner helper method for restoring the connections in a network of cloned cells.

member.summary: Invoked after a cell has been added to a parent. This recursively creates an Id for the new cell and/or resolves Id collisions.

member.summary: Creates a new Id for the given cell and increments the global counter for creating new Ids.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.MergeChildren(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxICell,imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxICell,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Merges the children of the given cell into the given target cell inside this model. All cells are cloned unless there is a corresponding cell in the model with the same id, in which case the source cell is ignored and all edges are connected to the corresponding cell in this model. Edges are considered to have no identity and are always cloned unless the cloneAllEdges flag is set to false, in which case edges with the same id in the target model are reconnected to reflect the terminals of the source edges.

member.name: M:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxGraphModel.MergeChildrenImpl(imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxICell,imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.model.mxICell,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Clones the children of the source cell into the given target cell in this model and adds an entry to the mapping that maps from the source cell to the target cell with the same id or the clone of the source cell that was inserted into this model.

member.name: T:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants
member.summary: Defines various global constants.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.DEFAULT_HOTSPOT
member.summary: Defines the portion of the cell which is to be used as a connectable region.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.MIN_HOTSPOT_SIZE
member.summary: Defines the minimum size in pixels of the portion of the cell cell which is to be used as a connectable region.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.NS_SVG
member.summary: Defines the SVG namespace.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.NS_XHTML
member.summary: Defines the XHTML namespace.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.NS_XLINK
member.summary: Defines the XLink namespace.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.DEFAULT_FONTFAMILIES
member.summary: Comma separated list of default fonts for CSS properties. And the default font family value for new image export. Default is Arial, Helvetica.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.DEFAULT_FONTFAMILY
member.summary: Default family for fonts. Default is Arial.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.DEFAULT_FONTSIZE
member.summary: Default size for fonts (in px). Value is 11.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.DEFAULT_STARTSIZE
member.summary: Defines the default start size for swimlanes. Default is 40.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.LINESPACING
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing. Default is 2.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.FONT_SIZEFACTOR
member.summary: Defines the factor to multiply font sizes in points to be used as font sizes in em. Default is 1/1.33 = 0.75.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.LABEL_INSET
member.summary: Defines the inset in absolute pixels between the label bounding box and the label text. Default is 3.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.DEFAULT_MARKERSIZE
member.summary: Default size for markers. Value is 6.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.DEFAULT_IMAGESIZE
member.summary: Defines the default width and height for images used in the label shape. Default is 24.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STENCIL_SHADOW_OPACITY
member.summary: Defines the default opacity for stencils shadows. Default is 1.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STENCIL_SHADOWCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the default shadow color for stencils. Default is "gray".

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.SHADOWCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the color to be used to draw shadows. Default is gray.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.SHADOW_OFFSETX
member.summary: Defines the x-offset to be used for shadows. Default is 2.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.SHADOW_OFFSETY
member.summary: Defines the y-offset to be used for shadows. Default is 3.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.W3C_SHADOWCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the color to be used to draw shadows in W3C standards. Default is gray.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.ENTITY_SEGMENT
member.summary: Defines the length of the horizontal segment of an Entity Relation. This can be overridden using mxConstants.STYLE_SEGMENT style. Default is 30.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.RECTANGLE_ROUNDING_FACTOR
member.summary: Defines the rounding factor for rounded rectangles in percent between 0 and 1. Values should be smaller than 0.5. Default is 0.15.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.LINE_ARCSIZE
member.summary: Defines the size of the arcs for rounded edges. Default is 10.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.ARROW_SPACING
member.summary: Defines the spacing between the arrow shape and its terminals. Default is 10.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.ARROW_WIDTH
member.summary: Defines the width of the arrow shape. Default is 30.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.ARROW_SIZE
member.summary: Defines the size of the arrowhead in the arrow shape. Default is 30.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.NONE
member.summary: Defines the value for none. Default is "none".

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_PERIMETER
member.summary: Defines the key for the perimeter style. Possible values are the functions defined in mxPerimeter.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SOURCE_PORT
member.summary: Defines the ID of the cell that should be used for computing the perimeter point of the source for an edge. This allows for graphically connecting to a cell while keeping the actual terminal of the edge.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_TARGET_PORT
member.summary: Defines the ID of the cell that should be used for computing the perimeter point of the target for an edge. This allows for graphically connecting to a cell while keeping the actual terminal of the edge.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_OPACITY
member.summary: Defines the key for the opacity style (0-100).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_FILL_OPACITY
member.summary: Defines the key for the text fill opacity style (0-100).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_STROKE_OPACITY
member.summary: Defines the key for the stroke opacity style (0-100).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_TEXT_OPACITY
member.summary: Defines the key for the text opacity style (0-100).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_OVERFLOW
member.summary: Defines the key for the overflow style. Possible values are "visible", "hidden" and "fill". The default value is "visible". This value specifies how overlapping vertex labels are handles. A value of "visible" will show the complete label. A value of "hidden" will clip the label so that it does not overlap the vertex bounds. A value of "fill" will use the vertex bounds for the label.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ORTHOGONAL
member.summary: Defines if the connection points on either end of the edge should be computed so that the edge is vertical or horizontal if possible and if the point is not at a fixed location. Default is false. This is used in mxGraph.IsOrthogonal, which also returns true if the edgeStyle of the edge is an elbow or entity.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_EXIT_X
member.summary: Defines the key for the horizontal relative coordinate connection point of an edge with its source terminal.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_EXIT_Y
member.summary: Defines the key for the vertical relative coordinate connection point of an edge with its source terminal.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_EXIT_PERIMETER
member.summary: Defines if the perimeter should be used to find the exact entry point along the perimeter of the source. Possible values are 0 (false) and 1 (true). Default is 1 (true).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ENTRY_X
member.summary: Defines the key for the horizontal relative coordinate connection point of an edge with its target terminal.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ENTRY_Y
member.summary: Defines the key for the vertical relative coordinate connection point of an edge with its target terminal.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ENTRY_PERIMETER
member.summary: Defines if the perimeter should be used to find the exact entry point along the perimeter of the target. Possible values are 0 (false) and 1 (true). Default is 1 (true).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_WHITE_SPACE
member.summary: Defines the key for the white-space style. Possible values are "nowrap" and "wrap". The default value is "nowrap". This value specifies how white-space inside a HTML vertex label should be handled. A value of "nowrap" means the text will never wrap to the next line until a linefeed is encountered. A value of "wrap" means text will wrap when necessary.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ROTATION
member.summary: Defines the key for the rotation style (0-360).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_FILLCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the fillColor style. The value is a string expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SWIMLANE_FILLCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the swimlaneFillColor style. The value is a string expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_GRADIENTCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the gradientColor style. The value is a string expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml. This is ignored if no fill color is defined.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_GRADIENT_DIRECTION
member.summary: Defines the key for the gradient direction. Possible values are DIRECTION_EAST, DIRECTION_WEST, DIRECTION_NORTH and DIRECTION_SOUTH. Default is DIRECTION_SOUTH. Generally, and by default in mxGraph, gradient painting is done from the value of STYLE_FILLCOLOR to the value of STYLE_GRADIENTCOLOR. Taking the example of DIRECTION_NORTH, this means STYLE_FILLCOLOR color at the bottom of paint pattern and STYLE_GRADIENTCOLOR at top, with a gradient in-between.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_STROKECOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the strokeColor style. The value is a string expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SEPARATORCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the separatorColor style. The value is a string expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml. This style is only used for SHAPE_SWIMLANE shapes.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_STROKEWIDTH
member.summary: Defines the key for the strokeWidth style. The type of the value is float and the possible range is any non-negative value. The value reflects the stroke width in pixels.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ALIGN
member.summary: Defines the key for the align style. Possible values are ALIGN_LEFT, ALIGN_CENTER and ALIGN_RIGHT. This value defines how the lines of the label are horizontally aligned. ALIGN_LEFT mean label text lines are aligned to left of the label bounds, ALIGN_RIGHT to the right of the label bounds and ALIGN_CENTER means the center of the text lines are aligned in the center of the label bounds. Note this value doesn't affect the positioning of the overall label bounds relative to the vertex, to move the label bounds horizontally, use STYLE_LABEL_POSITION

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN
member.summary: Defines the key for the verticalAlign style. Possible values are ALIGN_TOP, ALIGN_MIDDLE and ALIGN_BOTTOM. This value defines how the lines of the label are vertically aligned. ALIGN_TOP means the topmost label text line is aligned against the top of the label bounds, ALIGN_BOTTOM means the bottom-most label text line is aligned against the bottom of the label bounds and ALIGN_MIDDLE means there is equal spacing between the topmost text label line and the top of the label bounds and the bottom-most text label line and the bottom of the label bounds. Note this value doesn't affect the positioning of the overall label bounds relative to the vertex, to move the label bounds vertically, use STYLE_VERTICAL_LABEL_POSITION.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_LABEL_POSITION
member.summary: Defines the key for the horizontal label position of vertices. Possible values are ALIGN_LEFT, ALIGN_CENTER and ALIGN_RIGHT. Default is ALIGN_CENTER. The label align defines the position of the label relative to the cell. ALIGN_LEFT means the entire label bounds is placed completely just to the left of the vertex, ALIGN_RIGHT means adjust to the right and ALIGN_CENTER means the label bounds are vertically aligned with the bounds of the vertex. Note this value doesn't affect the positioning of label within the label bounds, to move the label horizontally within the label bounds, use STYLE_ALIGN.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_VERTICAL_LABEL_POSITION
member.summary: Defines the key for the vertical label position of vertices. Possible values are ALIGN_TOP, ALIGN_BOTTOM and ALIGN_MIDDLE. Default is ALIGN_MIDDLE. The label align defines the position of the label relative to the cell. ALIGN_TOP means the entire label bounds is placed completely just on the top of the vertex, ALIGN_BOTTOM means adjust on the bottom and ALIGN_MIDDLE means the label bounds are horizontally aligned with the bounds of the vertex. Note this value doesn't affect the positioning of label within the label bounds, to move the label vertically within the label bounds, use STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE_ALIGN
member.summary: Defines the key for the align style. Possible values are ALIGN_LEFT, ALIGN_CENTER and ALIGN_RIGHT. The value defines how any image in the vertex label is aligned horizontally within the label bounds of a SHAPE_LABEL shape.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE_VERTICAL_ALIGN
member.summary: Defines the key for the verticalAlign style. Possible values are ALIGN_TOP, ALIGN_MIDDLE and ALIGN_BOTTOM. The value defines how any image in the vertex label is aligned vertically within the label bounds of a SHAPE_LABEL shape.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_GLASS
member.summary: Defines the key for the glass style. Possible values are 0 (disabled) and 1(enabled). The default value is 0. This is used in mxLabel.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE
member.summary: Defines the key for the image style. Possible values are any image URL, registered key in mxImageResources or short data URI as defined in mxImageBundle. The type of the value is String. This is the path to the image to image that is to be displayed within the label of a vertex. See mxGraphics2DCanvas.getImageForStyle, loadImage and setImageBasePath on how the image URL is resolved. Finally, mxUtils.loadImage is used for loading the image for a given URL.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE_WIDTH
member.summary: Defines the key for the imageWidth style. The type of this value is int, the value is the image width in pixels and must be greated than 0.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE_HEIGHT
member.summary: Defines the key for the imageHeight style The type of this value is int, the value is the image height in pixels and must be greater than 0.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE_BACKGROUND
member.summary: Defines the key for the image background color. This style is only used for image shapes. Possible values are all HTML color names or HEX codes.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE_BORDER
member.summary: Defines the key for the image border color. This style is only used for image shapes. Possible values are all HTML color names or HEX codes.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE_FLIPH
member.summary: Defines the key for the horizontal image flip. This style is only used in mxImageShape. Possible values are 0 and 1. Default is 0.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_IMAGE_FLIPV
member.summary: Defines the key for the vertical image flip. This style is only used in mxImageShape. Possible values are 0 and 1. Default is 0.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_NOLABEL
member.summary: Defines the key for the noLabel style. If this is true then no label is visible for a given cell. Possible values are true or false (1 or 0). Default is false (0).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_NOEDGESTYLE
member.summary: Defines the key for the noEdgeStyle style. If this is true then no edge style is applied for a given edge. Possible values are true or false (1 or 0). Default is false.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_LABEL_BACKGROUNDCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the label background color. The value is a string expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_LABEL_BORDERCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the label border color. The value is a string expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_INDICATOR_SHAPE
member.summary: Defines the key for the indicatorShape style. Possible values are any of the SHAPE_* constants.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_INDICATOR_IMAGE
member.summary: Defines the key for the indicatorImage style. Possible values are any image URL, the type of the value is String.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_INDICATOR_COLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the indicatorColor style. The value is a string expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_INDICATOR_GRADIENTCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the indicatorGradientColor style. The value is a string expression supported byColorTranslator.FromHtml. This style is only supported in SHAPE_LABEL shapes.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_INDICATOR_SPACING
member.summary: Defines the key for the indicatorSpacing style (in px).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_INDICATOR_WIDTH
member.summary: Defines the key for the indicatorWidth style (in px).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_INDICATOR_HEIGHT
member.summary: Defines the key for the indicatorHeight style (in px).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SHADOW
member.summary: Defines the key for the shadow style. The type of the value is boolean. This style applies to vertices and arrow style edges.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SEGMENT
member.summary: Defines the key for the segment style. The type of this value is float and the value represents the size of the horizontal segment of the entity relation style. Default is ENTITY_SEGMENT.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ENDARROW
member.summary: Defines the key for the endArrow style. Possible values are all constants in this class that start with ARROW_. This style is supported in the mxConnector shape.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_STARTARROW
member.summary: Defines the key for the startArrow style. Possible values are all constants in this class that start with ARROW_. See STYLE_ENDARROW. This style is supported in the mxConnector shape.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ENDSIZE
member.summary: Defines the key for the endSize style. The type of this value is float and the value represents the size of the end marker in pixels.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_STARTSIZE
member.summary: Defines the key for the startSize style. The type of this value is float and the value represents the size of the start marker or the size of the swimlane title region depending on the shape it is used for.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_DASHED
member.summary: Defines the key for the dashed style. The type of this value is boolean and the value determines whether or not an edge or border is drawn with a dashed pattern along the line.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ROUNDED
member.summary: Defines the key for the rounded style. The type of this value is boolean. For edges this determines whether or not joins between edges segments are smoothed to a rounded finish. For vertices that have the rectangle shape, this determines whether or not the rectangle is rounded.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SOURCE_PERIMETER_SPACING
member.summary: Defines the key for the source perimeter spacing. The type of this value is double. This is the distance between the source connection point of an edge and the perimeter of the source vertex in pixels. This style only applies to edges.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_TARGET_PERIMETER_SPACING
member.summary: Defines the key for the target perimeter spacing. The type of this value is double. This is the distance between the target connection point of an edge and the perimeter of the target vertex in pixels. This style only applies to edges.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_PERIMETER_SPACING
member.summary: Defines the key for the perimeter spacing. This is the distance between the connection point and the perimeter in pixels. When used in a vertex style, this applies to all incoming edges to floating ports (edges that terminate on the perimeter of the vertex). When used in an edge style, this spacing applies to the source and target separately, if they terminate in floating ports (on the perimeter of the vertex).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SPACING
member.summary: Defines the key for the spacing. The value represents the spacing, in pixels, added to each side of a label in a vertex (style applies to vertices only).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SPACING_TOP
member.summary: Defines the key for the spacingTop style. The value represents the spacing, in pixels, added to the top side of a label in a vertex (style applies to vertices only).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SPACING_LEFT
member.summary: Defines the key for the spacingLeft style. The value represents the spacing, in pixels, added to the left side of a label in a vertex (style applies to vertices only).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SPACING_BOTTOM
member.summary: Defines the key for the spacingBottom style The value represents the spacing, in pixels, added to the bottom side of a label in a vertex (style applies to vertices only).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SPACING_RIGHT
member.summary: Defines the key for the spacingRight style The value represents the spacing, in pixels, added to the right side of a label in a vertex (style applies to vertices only).

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_HORIZONTAL
member.summary: Defines the key for the horizontal style. Possible values are true or false. This value only applies to vertices. If the STYLE_SHAPE is SHAPE_SWIMLANE a value of false indicates that the swimlane should be drawn vertically, true indicates to draw it horizontally. If the shape style does not indicate that this vertex is a swimlane, this value affects only whether the label is drawn horizontally or vertically.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_DIRECTION
member.summary: Defines the key for the direction style. The direction style is used to specify the direction of certain shapes (eg. mxTriangle). Possible values are DIRECTION_EAST (default), DIRECTION_WEST, DIRECTION_NORTH and DIRECTION_SOUTH. This value only applies to vertices.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ELBOW
member.summary: Defines the key for the elbow style. Possible values are ELBOW_HORIZONTAL and ELBOW_VERTICAL. Default is ELBOW_HORIZONTAL. This defines how the three segment orthogonal edge style leaves its terminal vertices. The vertical style leaves the terminal vertices at the top and bottom sides.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_FONTCOLOR
member.summary: Defines the key for the fontColor style. The value is type String and of the expression supported by ColorTranslator.FromHtml.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_FONTFAMILY
member.summary: Defines the key for the fontFamily style. Possible values are names such as Arial; Dialog; Verdana; Times New Roman. The value is of type String.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_FONTSIZE
member.summary: Defines the key for the fontSize style (in px). The type of the value is int.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_FONTSTYLE
member.summary: Defines the key for the fontStyle style. Values may be any logical AND (sum) of FONT_BOLD, FONT_ITALIC and FONT_UNDERLINE. The type of the value is int.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_SHAPE
member.summary: Defines the key for the shape style. Possible values are any of the SHAPE_* constants.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_EDGE
member.summary: Takes a function that creates points. Possible values are the functions defined in mxEdgeStyle.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_LOOP
member.summary: Defines the key for the loop style. Possible values are the functions defined in mxEdgeStyle.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ROUTING_CENTER_X
member.summary: Defines the key for the horizontal routing center. Possible values are between -0.5 and 0.5. This is the relative offset from the center used for connecting edges. The type of this value is float.

member.name: F:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.utils.mxConstants.STYLE_ROUTING_CENTER_Y
member.summary: Defines the key for the vertical routing center. Possible values are between -0.5 and 0.5. This is the relative offset from the center used for connecting edges. The type of this value is float.

member.name: T:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.view.mxEdgeStyleFunction
member.summary: Defines the requirements for an edge style function. At the time the function is called, the result array contains a placeholder (null) for the first absolute point, that is, the point where the edge and source terminal are connected. The implementation of the style then adds all intermediate waypoints except for the last point, that is, the connection point between the edge and the target terminal. The first ant the last point in the result array are then replaced with mxPoints that take into account the terminal's perimeter and next point on the edge.
member.param: Cell state that represents the edge to be updated.
Cell state that represents the source terminal.
Cell state that represents the target terminal.
Array of points that represent the actual points of the edge.

member.name: T:imbSCI.Graph.MXGraph.view.mxGraphView
member.summary: Implements a view for the graph. This class is in charge of computing the absolute coordinates for the relative child geometries, the points for perimeters and edge styles and keeping them cached in mxCellStates for faster retrieval. The states are updated whenever the model or the view state (translate, scale) changes. The scale and translate are honoured in the bounds.

summary.para: imbSCI.Graph is an extension package for imbSCI library, extending graph classes with undirected graph object model and implementation for DGML, Dia, MXGraph (Draw.io) and DOT graph formats. Supports SVG rendering of charts (histograms, pie, bar and linear charts - in 2D and 3D.) and graph structures.

remarks.para: The main datastructure of the library is , a non-hierarchical graph with weighted nodes and links.

item.description: Use extensions to convert between graphs, and
Use and to export graph structured for visualisation in Visual Studio or GraphViz
There are several utility classes for quering and analysis of , like: , ,

member.name: T:Svg.SvgClipRule
member.summary: Indicates the algorithm which is to be used to determine the clipping region.

remarks.para: This rule determines the "insideness" of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.

member.name: F:Svg.SvgClipRule.NonZero
member.summary: This rule determines the "insideness" of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a path segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path. Otherwise, it is inside.

member.name: F:Svg.SvgClipRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: This rule determines the "insideness" of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

DocumentTypeThe internal subset. ProcessingInstructionThe entire content, excluding the target. SignificantWhitespaceThe white space within an xml:space= 'preserve' scope. TextThe content of the text node. WhitespaceThe white space between markup. XmlDeclarationThe content of the declaration.
